text.0: present to varuṇa thine hymn vasiṣṭha bright most delightful to the bounteous giver.
text.1: who bringeth on to us the bull the lofty the holy laden with a thousand treasures.
text.2: and now as i am come before his presence i take the face of varuṇa for agnis.
text.3: so might he bringlord also of the darknessthe light in heaven that i may see its beauty.
text.4: when varuṇa and i embark together and urge our boat into the midst of ocean.
text.5: we when we ride oer ridges of the waters will swing within that swing and there be happy.
text.6: varuṇa placed vasiṣṭha in the vessel and deftly with his niight made him a Ṛṣi.
text.7: when days shone bright the sage made him a singer while the heavens broadened and the dawns were lengthened.
text.8: what hath become of those our ancient friendships when without enmity we walked together.
text.9: i varuṇa thou glorious lord have entered thy lofty home thine house with thousand portals.
text.10: if he thy true ally hath sinned against thee still varuṇa he is the friend thou lovedst.
text.11: let us not living one as sinners i know thee give shelter as a sage to him who lauds thee.
text.12: while we abide in these fixed habitations and from the lap of aditi win favour.
text.13: may varuṇa untie the bond that binds us preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
